intro: Pavetta javanica var. tidorensis, commonly known as Tidore pavetta, is a flowering plant native to the Maluku Islands of Indonesia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many ornamental and economically important species. The plant typically grows as a shrub with opposite, ovate leaves that are glossy and dark green. Its flowers are small, clustered in cymes, and feature white to pale pink petals with prominent yellow stamens. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, smooth seeds.
